marklogic.body: That is just the beginning. Inside the bill, the HHS has the power to regulate is insurance companies cover these kinds of procedures on a company by company basis, or a region by region basis. Â The HHS will determine if insurers cover the cost of mammograms, GYN visits and in what frequency they do so. It's in Â the bill! You are Spot on. And in 2018, when the HHS is using actuarials ( it's in the bill) to determine if these procedures are covered for women at a certain age, women will be denied coverage for certain procedures before a certain age. Of course, they can Always pay out of pocket. The largest denier of claims by a health care provider in the U.S. is medicare at 6.8 percent of claims. Government, or socialized medicine, is not the panacea many believe it is.Â
